The Deathtouch really meant that: 'You with the control deck. Don't think your walls can stop me for long.' Sooner and later, he will hit though and get you.

posts.post_content:
Love this card!  
  
Try using him and Captivating Vampire!  
  
Tap 5 vamps. Target Grave Titan. BOOM! You have a Vampire Giant that is 7/7 and craps out little baby zombies.  
  
Now most people hate Captivating Vampire but vamps and zombies are going to rule the hell out of the game, just watch.  
  
@bobjunior  
How does that work? Double strike doesn't make the creature attack twice it just deals Damage during both first strike stage and normal stage combat damage step. It NEVER attacks twice. ONLY way for your strategy to work is with World at War. And then you get your 4 tokens. Just take a look at [Double Cleave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Double Cleave). It explains what double strike does. Or simply look up rules on it.

posts.post_content:
I think that in actuality [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan) is the most powerful of the M11 Titans. While [Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan) is of course the attractive one because of its immense card advantage and ramping capability, [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan) instead brings it with raw power. He has the advantage in damage-dealing over his red comrade [Inferno Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inferno Titan) in the obvious advantage that he can't be destroyed by [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) and in the more subtle advantage that he spreads his power over multiple bodies. By necessity, three creatures are much harder to remove than one. [Day of Judgmen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgmen)t is the only thing he fears.  
  
Although each of the Titans have a defining board presence, I think his is the most definitive. He can swing games around nearly immediately, providing three creatures for the price of one- one of those creatures being remarkably explosive and dangerous (himself, of course). He complicates combat with ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: The_Trendkill (8/25/2010 7:40:03 PM)
Rating:

@Gomorrah - he's talking about waiting a turn so that you can create an additional 2 tokens by attacking, then saccing 3 tokens for a Demon of Death's Gate. So you're not trading 10 points of power across 3 creatures; you're trading 5 across 3 token creatures.
@Blkmgc81 - Primeval is worth more because, in constructed, the fact that he can search for any land makes him a combo boss. There are 4 or 5 competitive decks that he's a staple in, as well as numerous, numerous rogue decks.

Having said that, Grave Titan is definitely, definitely a great card. In limited he's just insane. It's always a huge pain in the rear when your opponent plays him. It's probably the one card that, on its own, can win a game. I remember the first time I played against in in limited - it was a very close stalemate with the opponent, who then played this. He proceed to completely overwhelm me in about 2 turns. When you talk about bombs in limited, this card could be the very definition.

In constructed he isn... (see all)

posts.post_content: U-caster, awful, awful idea. Absolutely dreadful. You're trading 10 damage across 3 creatures and 6 damage from yourself for 9 damage with evasion. Removal exists. I hate to bring up the "It dies to removal" argument, but in this case, it's quite a glaring point. If you Path Grave Titan, you still have 2 2/2s to attack your opponent with, but with DoDG, you're down 4 creatures and 6 life.

Posted By: Ph1005 (8/2/2010 9:16:10 PM)
Rating:

@Donovan_Fabian

In a column on the WotC website, one of the 2011 designers gave the reason this Titan makes tokens. Turns out a sketch of the art for this guy came in befor they had figured out what his ability would be. And said sketch featured a bunch of zombies falling out of the Titan's gut. So it was decreed that this Titan would make Zombie tokens.

As to why he has Deathtouch, the design team wanted him to have a keyword ability, and due to the strength of making two Zombie tokens, they wanted one that wouldn't add too much power. Deathtouch was perfect for the job.
